update.description:
It requires [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-tools/pull-requests/1) pull request.

Each Ignition library should install a `.yaml` file and a `.rb` file. The `.yaml` file contains metadata about the commands that are exposed in the library. As an example, I have implemented `ign topic list` and `ign service list` in ignition-transport.

There are a few C functions that are included in the library to interact with the ruby script:

  * Version(): Returns the library version.
  * cmdTopicList(): Implements `ign topic -l [--list]`
  * cmdServiceList(): Implements `ign service -l [--list]`

How do I test it? 

* Go to the `example/` directory and run a `responser`. Then, type `ign service -l`.
* Go to the `example/` directory and run a `publisher`. Then, type `ign topic -l`.

And of course you can poke around with any other option.
update.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

pullrequest.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

content.raw:
ign_TEST was broken, I forgot to update the command to the new `-l` syntax. Fixed in 5a5b4eb and 7f38ea9.

I don't get the other error. Is it reproducible? Try to use `IGN_PARTITION` to make sure you don't get cross-talking behaviors.
content.html:
ign_TEST was broken, I forgot to update the command to the new -l syntax. Fixed in 5a5b4eb and 7f38ea9.

I don't get the other error. Is it reproducible? Try to use IGN_PARTITION to make sure you don't get cross-talking behaviors.

update.description:
It requires [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-tools/pull-requests/1) pull request.

A new `transport.yaml` file is installed with metadata about the commands that we handle in Ignition Transport. As an example, I have implemented `ign topic list` and `ign service list`.

There are two new C functions that are included in the library:
  * Version(): Returns the library version.
  * execute(argc, argv): Execute a command line utility (e.g.:topic list, service list, etc.).

How do I test it? 

* Go to the `example/` directory and run a `responser`. Then, type `ign service list`.
* Go to the `example/` directory and run a `publisher`. Then, type `ign topic list`.
update.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

pullrequest.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

content.raw: The `-l` is optional, in the long run you will have echo (`-e`), info (`-i`), hertz('-z'), etc. If no option is selected, then output the help. The help should indicate which options can be combined and which can't. Take a look at `man tar`.
content.html: The -l is optional, in the long run you will have echo (-e), info (-i), hertz('-z'), etc. If no option is selected, then output the help. The help should indicate which options can be combined and which can't. Take a look at man tar.

pull_request.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

pullrequest.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

content.raw: I thought about this to be consistent with `gz` but the caveats are that the `-l` looks like an optional argument and in this case we need a mandatory positional argument after `topic`. The `-l` notation can also give the impression that you can use multiple options. However, only one sub-command is allowed at a time. I'm totally opened to change it if we believe it's still better.
content.html: I thought about this to be consistent with gz but the caveats are that the -l looks like an optional argument and in this case we need a mandatory positional argument after topic. The -l notation can also give the impression that you can use multiple options. However, only one sub-command is allowed at a time. I'm totally opened to change it if we believe it's still better.

pull_request.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

pullrequest.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

content.raw: How about we stick with the `<utility> <command> <args>` style. For example `ign service -l` for listing services. Using dashed arguments is a standard approach and makes it easier to pass parameters to the arguments.
content.html: How about we stick with the <utility> <command> <args> style. For example ign service -l for listing services. Using dashed arguments is a standard approach and makes it easier to pass parameters to the arguments.

pull_request.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

pullrequest.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

content.raw: Reverting it to 1 sec. based on a conversation with @nkoenig. Agreed that we probably shouldn't change the behavior of the transport based on an optional tool. We'll learn with the usage which is the appropriate value for this parameter.
content.html: Reverting it to 1 sec. based on a conversation with @nkoenig. Agreed that we probably shouldn't change the behavior of the transport based on an optional tool. We'll learn with the usage which is the appropriate value for this parameter.

update.description:
It requires [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-tools/pull-requests/1) pull request.

A new `transport.yaml` file is installed with metadata about the commands that we handle in Ignition Transport. As an example, I have implemented `ign topic list` and `ign service list`.

There are two new C functions that are included in the library:
  * Version(): Returns the library version.
  * execute(argc, argv): Execute a command line utility (e.g.:topic list, service list, etc.).

How do I test it? 

* Go to the `example/` directory and run a `responser`. Then, type `ign service list`.
* Go to the `example/` directory and run a `publisher`. Then, type `ign topic list`.
update.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

pull_request.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

pullrequest.title: Initial layout for being able to execute transport command line commands with `ign`.

content.raw: When running `ign topic list` or `ign service list` we have to create a new node that listens advertise messages during some time, and then, prints the topic names. The longer the `advertiseInterval`, the longer we will have to wait for advertise messages. Of course, if we set the value too low, we will flood the network with control messages. I thought 500ms. would be a good compromise.
content.html: When running ign topic list or ign service list we have to create a new node that listens advertise messages during some time, and then, prints the topic names. The longer the advertiseInterval, the longer we will have to wait for advertise messages. Of course, if we set the value too low, we will flood the network with control messages. I thought 500ms. would be a good compromise.
